Event.name: Borrowing
Event.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Borrower</fen> takes possession of a <fen>Theme</fen> with the knowledge that the <fen>Borrower</fen> will have to give the <fen>Theme</fen> back to the <fen>Lender</fen> after a <fen>Duration</fen> of time. This frame differs from the Lending frame in that this frame profiles the Borrower in active sentences, whereas the Lending frame profiles the Lender. <ex></ex> For the time being, this frame includes both the transfer event itself and the end state of the event, as shown in the first two examples following:
<ex><fex name="Borrower">I</fex> am <t>borrowing</t> <fex name="Theme">the book about modal particles</fex> <fex name="Lender">from the professor</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Borrower">I</fex> <t>borrowed</t> <fex name="Theme">the book</fex> <fex name="Lender">from him</fex> and returned it <fex name="Time">a long time ago</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Not only did <fex name="Borr">I</fex> have to <t>borrow</t> <fex name="Theme">a gown</fex>, but I was also lent a jacket!</ex>
<ex><fex name="Borr">The girl</fex> <t>borrowed</t> <fex name="Theme">the car</fex> <fex name="Lender">from her sister</fex> <fex name="Duration">for a couple days</fex>.</ex>
Along with other ways of temporarily taking possession (e.g. "putting something in your pocket for a while"), this frame is used non-literally to refer to Stealing. In this use, the <fen>Borrower</fen> is a thief, the <fen>Lender</fen> is a Victim, and the <fen>Theme</fen> is the Goods:
<ex>Were n't nobody lookin' so <fex name="Borrower">I</fex> <t>borrowed</t> <fex name="Theme">it</fex> <fex name="Lender">off her</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Borrower
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person who receives the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Borr">Tracy</fex> <t>borrowed</t> that book from Leonard last week.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount of time for which the <fen>Borrower</fen> has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Lender
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person or institution who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Borrower</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>. <ex>Tracy <t>borrowed</t> that book <fex name="Lend">from Leonard</fex> last week.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The object that the <fen>Borrower</fen> receives from the <fen>Lender</fen> for a <fen>Duration</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The aim of the <fen>Borrower</fen> which they believe will be accomplished by possessing the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means_of_transfer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The means by which the transfer of the <fen>Theme</fen> took place.
<ex>I <t>borrowed</t> money from my dad <fex name="Means">via Western Union</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Borrower</fen> gets the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen>.
<ex>I am <t>borrowing</t> his car <fex name="Pla">at the airport</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The way in which the <fen>Borrower</fen> gains possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> from the <fen>Lender</fen>.
<ex>I <fex name="Man">hastily </fex><t>borrowed</t> the keys from his belt.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: borrow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to take possession of something with the knowledge that it must be given back
